Events that occurred on 3 November.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1943 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 51a.
1968 - A Warm Welcome, the sixth episode of the 1968 radio series of The Hobbit, is aired on BBC Radio.
2004 - "Shadows", the eleventh set in The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game, is released.
2010 - Author Glen GoodKnight dies.
2016 - The Lay of Aotrou and Itroun is published.
2016 - The Bodleian Library presented the Bodley Medal to Christopher Tolkien, the Library's highest honour.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
First quarter[1]
T.A. 3019:
Battle of Bywater[2]
Passing of Saruman and death of Gríma Wormtongue
End of the War of the Ring

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull (eds), The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion, p. xlviii
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix B, "The Chief Days from the Fall of Barad-dûr to the End of the Third Age"
